value.name: Suburban Milwaukee police officer who fatally shot 3 since 2015 resigns
value.description: Protests followed the most recent shooting outside Mayfair Mall. Alvin Cole, 17, was shot five times by Mensah after he fled from police following a disturbance inside the mall. Mensah said Cole ...

value.name: A year after George Floyd's murder, families of those slain by police want lasting change
value.description: Family members converged on Minneapolis to implore Americans to turn last year's moment into a sustaining movement for change.

value.name: Judge Deciding Whether To Charge Cop For Justified Shooting Has Ex-Wife Who Represented Dead Suspect’s Family
value.description: The ex-wife of the Milwaukee County judge tasked with deciding whether or not a former Wauwatosa police officer will face charges for a fatal officer-involved shooting is also an attorney who has represented the family of the suspect the officer killed.

value.name: One year after the death of George Floyd, a Wauwatosa moms group focused on addressing racism is calling for more change
value.description: Tosa Moms Tackling Racism gathered to remember George Floyd Tuesday on the one-year anniversary of his death as members also called for more police reform.

video.name: Floyd family meets with Pres. Biden, urges 'Justice in Policing Act' one year after death

value.name: Lives that mattered: Remembering George Floyd
value.description: The families came from all over the country to Minneapolis to honor George Floyd one year after his killing. They all had one tragic thing in common: Their loved ones’ names became synonymous with a movement only because of their deaths.

value.name: 'Remember Their Names' rally takes place in Washington Park

value.name: Bullhorn Films Documents Protests

value.name: Families Gather To Remember Loved Ones Killed During Interactions With Milwaukee-Area Police
value.description: Sunday afternoon in Milwaukee, about a dozen local Black families whose loved ones died during interactions with police gathered at Washington Park to remember those who passed away.

value.name: A judge will decide whether to charge ex-Wauwatosa Police Officer Joseph Mensah in the 2016 shooting death of Jay Anderson Jr.
value.description: Joseph Mensah was cleared by the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office five years ago in a fatal shooting. Now, a judge will make the decision.
